profileAlternative.name: Ashish Arora
profileAlternative.headline: Data Scientist at Autodesk
profileAlternative.summary:
Bigger and better data can give organizations both more panoramic as well as more granular views of their business phenomena. This realization has dawned upon me through my internship experiences. Furthermore, working on individual projects pertaining to various analytical and statistical techniques (logistic regression, linear regression, cluster analysis, RFM analysis and time series forecasting) has made me realize the potential that data crunching possesses.

I am a graduate student at Carnegie Mellon University pursuing Master of Information Systems Management. I have a penchant towards exploring the field of Data Analytics/Business Intelligence and am currently seeking summer 2018 Internship opportunities. I aim at taking up a role pioneering in data-based decision-making that can help catalyze the growth of an organization.

Technical Skills: Python, R, Spark, Hadoop, JAVA, SAS, Minitab
Visualization Tools: Tableau, Excel, Matplotlib, Seaborn, R Shiny, plot.ly
Database Technologies: Oracle 11g (SQL), MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra, Neo4j

given.text:
It’s my pleasure to recommend Ashish

Even as python coder at jr level (start of career) he left good image in my mind!

He has shown immense amount of dedication & sincerity towards work. Quick learner and absolutely focused on the work assignment. He could do the tasks which even his sr. team members couldn’t do in time. I like to recommend him for any technical work & data analytics assignment.

I wish him good luck & all success in life.
Rajesh Jain
See less

Ashish is a one of a kind data science professional who accomplished a store segmentation project for Hallmark in less than 11 weeks. He has strong motivation and dedication to success.

I had the pleasure of working with Ashish at Hallmark during his internship as a data scientist. I was particularly impressed by Ashish's ability to go above and beyond expectations and willingness to pitch in for the team. Not only had he completed store segmentation on time, he had created a first-ever data dictionary tool at Hallmark to make the search of 3,000+ tables a breeze. He also created a file formatting app that allowed an associate to spend the time on generating insights rather than manipulating the files.

Oh, and not to mention he is easy to get along with!

Ashish would be a true asset for anyone looking for a highly-motivated data scientist and comes with my heartfelt recommendation. See less
